instructions: Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 1 1 Open your internet browser on your computer. You will need to download Apple s Xcode integrated development environment (IDE) to your computer before you can start playing with your iPhone s developer options. Xcode is a Mac-only application. It is only available to computers running Mac OS. Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 2 2 Go to Apple s Developer Downloads page. This is where you can download the latest beta releases Apple makes available for software developers. Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 3 3 Sign in with your Apple ID. Enter your email and password to sign into the developer portal with your Apple ID. If you haven t signed in with your Apple ID on your computer before, you will need to verify your identity by entering a verification code. You can access this code on your iPhone, or on any other device that you re automatically signed in with your Apple ID. Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 4 4 Click next to Xcode. Under the heading Release Software , hit the Download button next to the latest Xcode release. This could be Xcode 8.3.1, or later. It will open a Mac App Store Preview page in a new tab. Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 5 5 Click . This button will be right below the Xcode app icon on the left-hand side of your browser screen. Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 6 6 Click in the pop-up box. It will open Xcode in the App Store application on your Mac. Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 7 7 Click . This button will be right below the Xcode icon in the upper-left corner of your App Store window. It will turn into a green Install App button. Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 8 8 Click the green button. This will download the latest release of Xcode and install it on your computer. Advertisement

Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 9 1 Open the Xcode app on your Mac. You will need to agree to the terms of the software and license agreements when you open Xcode for the first time. This will install software components and finalize the Xcode installation process. Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 10 2 Plug your iPhone into your Mac. Use your USB cable to plug your phone into your computer. Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 11 3 Open the Settings app on your iPhone. This is the gray gear icon on your iPhone s Home screen. Image titled Enable Developer Mode on an iPhone Step 12 4 Scroll down and tap . This option will automatically appear next to a hammer icon on your iPhone s Settings menu when you plug it into your computer while running Xcode. Seeing this option in your Settings means you have enabled developer mode on your iPhone. You can now start demoing apps, checking logs, and playing with other developer settings on your device.
